> 20 hours ago, munlander1 said:

> What's the nature of this stuff?
> 

We don't speak about specifics of the moderation action taken, if any, of a specific member. So questions along the lines of "I reported this post, what did you guys do about it?" or "Why did so-and-so get banned?" won't be answered. This occasionally causes some mild difficulty for us as when two or more users devolving into name-calling or similar, they might all receive moderator attention but no one ever believes that they other people did too.

We also have some tools and techniques that we use when moderating that we don't discuss publicly; giving information about these makes them easier to sidestep.
Thanks
Why does it take so long for a thread to be unlocked when it is being maintained?

> 
> 
> 11 minutes ago, munlander1 said:
> 
> 
> Why does it take so long for a thread to be unlocked when it is being maintained?
> 

Sometimes it's not very long, but in cases where it takes some time, the moderators must be careful to discuss and maintain collaboration with each other in order to set the thread back on course in the best possible way. Call it bureaucracy, but the red tape we take on goes miles to ensure the quality and forum-appropriate content of a thread.
[@munlander1](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/168560-munlander1/) Also some times threads need a bit of a cool off period.

> 
> 
> Just now, Frybert said:
> 
> 
> Also some times threads need a bit of a cool off period.
> 

I can think of many situations where that would be useful.

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, munlander1 said:
> 
> 
> Why does it take so long for a thread to be unlocked when it is being maintained?
> 

Depends on the situation. Behind-the-scenes activity can include: 

1) Lock thread. 

2) Read thread. (Can take some time.) 

3) Compose warn messages as called for. 

3a) Check previous warn histories for people being cited. (If they have previous, similar warns, new warns will be for more points.) 

4) Consult with other moderators. 

5) Re-open thread.

How do you merge a thread?

> 
> 
> 28 minutes ago, munlander1 said:
> 
> 
> How do you merge a thread?
> 

It's rather simple, we have to be viewing the thread into which other posts will be merged, then hit the "merge" button in the "Moderation Actions" menu, a dialog shows asking for the URL of the thread about to be merged (which I'm never smart enough to have copied in advance ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")). There are a couple technical things to be careful about, as IPS can get confused if we don't pay attention to something in the status of merging posts (we learned those the hard way).
